title: Holy Asymmetrical A
content:
This font was used in an issue of Swindle. It later haunted me from a bus bench. I just love it. Does anyone know what it’s called, and what typeface it’s based on?

Thanks!

 [‹ Clarendon variant?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41882 "Go to previous forum topic") [transitional in lead ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41875 "Go to next forum topic")
author: michelleleclerc

comments.content:
I tried to post the picture, but here’s a link.

[http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2070/2250607723\_91c535ab91.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747/http:/farm3.static.flickr.com/2070/2250607723_91c535ab91.jpg "http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2070/2250607723\_91c535ab91.jpg")

this typeface appeared for only one issue, iirc.

I was also curious to find out who made it.

influenced by the Avant Garde [alternates](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/avant-garde-gothic-alternates-are-back/)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/2250607723_91c535ab91_6141.jpg)

a few more looks at it

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ws_3550.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821151747im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ws3_5362.jpg)
wow, great job. Thank you so much!
